newsitem.title: UK: Predator Regan drops plan to bid for Britain's CWS.
newsitem.headline: Predator Regan drops plan to bid for Britain's CWS.

text.p: Galileo Group, the special bidding vehicle set up by entrepreneur Andrew Regan to bid for Britain's Co-operative Wholesale Society (CWS) said on Thursday it would not pursue its bid after the CWS chairman rejected its invitation to put its plans to CWS members.

"In the light of this response, Galileo announces that it will not be pursuing its proposal," the group said in a statement. Regan has been stalking the mutually-owned Co-op for several months but an expected 1.2 billion pound ($1.9 billion) bid was thwarted when the CWS took court action.
